alert.note: Alert for Carbon; Lehigh; Monroe; Northampton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 19 at 1:32PM EST until February 19 at 1:45PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM EST FOR NORTHERN LEHIGH...CARBON...MONROE AND NORTHAMPTON COUNTIES... At 131 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Echo Lake to Northampton, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 62 and 91. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 68 and 69. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 285 and 314. Interstate 80 in New Jersey near mile marker 3. Interstate 380 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 13. Locations impacted include... Allentown, Lehighton, Mount Pocono, Bethlehem, Northampton, East Stroudsburg, Tobyhanna, Hellertown, Nazareth, Palmerton, Bangor, Jim Thorpe, Slatington, Pen Argyl, Wind Gap, Bath, Walnutport, Belfast, Tatamy and East Bangor. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
